member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.AzureStorage.StorageTransientErrorDetectionStrategy.StorageV1ExceptionChecker
member.summary: Provides support for checking transient faults when using the Azure Storage v1 managed API.
member.remarks: This type avoids externalizing the usage of the Azure Storage assembly, so that if the application is using another version of the assembly, then this type does not throw exceptions when the JIT compiler tries to load this version of the assembly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.AzureStorage.StorageTransientErrorDetectionStrategy.StorageV2ExceptionChecker
member.summary: Provides support for checking transient faults when using the Azure Storage v2 managed API.
member.remarks: This type avoids externalizing the usage of the Azure Storage assembly, so that if the application is using another version of the assembly, then this type does not throw exceptions when the JIT compiler tries to load this version of the assembly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.Cache.DataCacheExceptionChecker
member.summary: Checks if an is of the Microsoft.ApplicationServer.Caching.DataCacheException type, and if it is, it checks the error code and status code to determine if it is transient. It dynamically discovers the type, to avoid a hard reference to the Microsoft.ApplicationServer.Caching.Core assembly (either version 1.0.0.0 or 101.0.0.0).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.Cache.DataCacheExceptionChecker.IsTransientDataCacheException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns true if the exception is
member.returns: if the exception is of type DataCacheException and is transient. if the exception is of type DataCacheException and is not transient. if the exception is not of type DataCacheException.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingMode
member.summary: Defines the possible throttling modes in SQL Azure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingMode.NoThrottling
member.summary: Corresponds to "No Throttling" throttling mode whereby all SQL statements can be processed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingMode.RejectUpdateInsert
member.summary: Corresponds to "Reject Update / Insert" throttling mode whereby SQL statements such as INSERT, UPDATE, CREATE TABLE and CREATE INDEX are rejected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingMode.RejectAllWrites
member.summary: Corresponds to "Reject All Writes" throttling mode whereby SQL statements such as INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, DROP are rejected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingMode.RejectAll
member.summary: Corresponds to "Reject All" throttling mode whereby all SQL statements are rejected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingMode.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown throttling mode whereby throttling mode cannot be determined with certainty.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingType
member.summary: Defines the possible throttling types in SQL Azure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingType.None
member.summary: Indicates that no throttling was applied to a given resource.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingType.Soft
member.summary: Corresponds to a Soft throttling type. Soft throttling is applied when machine resources such as, CPU, IO, storage, and worker threads exceed predefined safety thresholds despite the load balancer’s best efforts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingType.Hard
member.summary: Corresponds to a Hard throttling type. Hard throttling is applied when the machine is out of resources, for example storage space. With hard throttling, no new connections are allowed to the databases hosted on the machine until resources are freed up.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottlingType.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown throttling type in the event when the throttling type cannot be determined with certainty.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottledResourceType
member.summary: Defines the types of resources in SQL Azure which may be subject to throttling conditions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottledResourceType.PhysicalDatabaseSpace
member.summary: Corresponds to "Physical Database Space" resource which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottledResourceType.PhysicalLogSpace
member.summary: Corresponds to "Physical Log File Space" resource which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottledResourceType.LogWriteIoDelay
member.summary: Corresponds to "Transaction Log Write IO Delay" resource which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottledResourceType.DataReadIoDelay
member.summary: Corresponds to "Database Read IO Delay" resource which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottledResourceType.Cpu
member.summary: Corresponds to "CPU" resource which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottledResourceType.DatabaseSize
member.summary: Corresponds to "Database Size" resource which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottledResourceType.WorkerThreads
member.summary: Corresponds to "SQL Worker Thread Pool" resource which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottledResourceType.Internal
member.summary: Corresponds to an internal resource which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.ThrottledResourceType.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown resource type in the event when the actual resource cannot be determined with certainty.
